**Possible Hands:**
1. **Pair of 6s** (6 of Spades + 6 of Diamonds)
   - Base: 10 chips, 2 mult
   - Cards contributing: 10 + 6 + 6 = 22 chips
   - Queen is a face card but won't be part of the pair, so Photograph triggers
   - Wait, no. Photograph says "First played face card gives X2 Mult when scored"
   - If I play the pair of 6s with the Queen, the Queen won't score (won't add chips) because it's not part of the pair
   - But will Photograph still trigger? Let me re-read: "First played face card gives X2 Mult when scored"
   - "When scored" suggests the face card needs to actually contribute to scoring
   - Since only cards that are part of the highest hand type contribute chips, the Queen wouldn't score
   - So Photograph likely wouldn't trigger

2. **Diamond Flush** (4 Diamonds)
   - I have: Ace, Queen, 6, 4 of Diamonds
   - Need 5 cards for a flush, only have 4 diamonds
   - Can't make this

3. **Club Flush** (3 Clubs)

   - If I play just the Queen: 5 + 10 = 15 chips, mult = 1
   - Photograph triggers: 15 chips × 2 = 30 chips
   - Very weak

I need to figure out my best strategy here. The pair of 6s seems promising if I can add more value, but I'm limited by what cards actually score in the hand.

Looking at what's left in the deck—9 diamonds, 12 spades, 10 clubs, and 10 hearts—I should focus on either building toward three of a kind to activate the Zany Joker, or getting more diamonds for a flush. The low cards like the 6s aren't strong enough on their own, so I'd want to keep the Queen and Ace as anchors while discarding weaker cards.

Let me reconsider the pair of 6s combined with the Queen by playing positions 1, 6, and 7 together.

The pair of 6s forms the only scoring hand here, giving me 22 chips total with a 2x multiplier. The Queen doesn't contribute to the hand itself, so it wouldn't score—which means Photograph's bonus wouldn't trigger since the effect requires the face card to actually score as part of the hand.

I need to find a better strategy. Keeping the Queen makes sense for future Photograph triggers, and the Ace has decent value. I'll discard most of the low cards to try drawing into something stronger like three of a kind or a flush. Positions 1, 2, 3, 4, and 7 seem like the best candidates to replace. That leaves me with Queen, Ace, and 4 of Diamonds in hand. With 4 plays and 3 discards remaining, I need to figure out how to reach 600 chips. The pair of 6s with Queen gives me at most 88 chips if Photograph triggers, which falls far short. I should discard the weak cards and rebuild around Queen and Ace instead.

With 36 cards remaining in the deck, drawing another diamond gives me roughly a 22% chance per card. I'm weighing whether to pursue the flush with my Queen or pivot toward three of a kind. The diamond flush scenario with the Queen would give me a strong multiplier, so that seems like the most promising path forward.

If I discard two cards now, I'd have a 40% chance of drawing at least one diamond from the remaining deck. That's decent odds for trying to complete the flush, though not guaranteed. I could also play it safer by keeping some flexibility. With four hands left after this one, I could attempt the flush now, and if it doesn't work out, I'd still have one more discard to try again. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
